info.title: FirstPromoter Promoters API
info.description: The Promoters API endpoint allows you to manage your affiliates/promoters through API calls. The most important use case is to automatically create promoter accounts for your customers.

post.description:
Use this endpoint to create new promoters using the API. The response will return the newly added promoter as JSON. Probably the most important value from the response is `auth_token`, which is a unique key auto-generated on creation and can be used to automatically log in your promoters to their dashboard. [Learn more](https://help.firstpromoter.com/faq/how-to-embed-the-promoter-dashboard-inside-your-website-and-log-your-users-in-automatically). If this call is successful and you enabled `Promoter sign up accepted` emails for the campaign, it will start sending emails to the promoter. To skip the emails, set the `skip_email_notification` parameter to `true`**HTTP Request**

`POST https://firstpromoter.com/api/v1/promoters/create`

parameters.name: cust_id
parameters.description: Your customer's user ID inside your application/system for the promoter. It will be avaliable in the webhooks to identify the promoter in your system if you subscribe for FirstPromoter webhooks.

parameters.name: ref_id
parameters.description: Referral ID. If this is blank an ID is assigned based on the first name. Can be only `lower-case letters` , `numbers` , `-`(hyphen) and `_`(underscore)

parameters.name: promo_code
parameters.description: Unique promo code from your billing provider to assign to this affiliate for coupon tracking. This is also known as the `Coupon Code` or `Coupon ID`

parameters.name: customer_promo_code
parameters.description: Customer promo code from your billing provider to assign to this affiliate for coupon tracking. This is also known as `discount code` or `promotion code` or `display code`. This is the code your customer(s) can use on the checkout form/page.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to assign the promoter to. On the campaigns sections you can see the id as `camp_id` query parameter on 'Promoter Sign Up page URL'. If there is no `camp_id` it means the campaign is the default campaign and this parameter is not required.

parameters.name: temp_password
parameters.description: A temporary password promoters can use to log in to their dashboard if you don't use authentication tokens(`auth_token`) to sign promoters in automatically.

parameters.name: landing_url
parameters.description: You can set up a custom landing page url for this promoter. The referral id will be appended to it, unless the `url_tracking` parameter(below) is used.

parameters.name: url_tracking
parameters.description: Set `true` to enable direct url tracking feature. FirstPromoter will do the tracking based on `landing_url`(above) without requiring the referral id to be appended to the url. The `landing_url` needs to be unique for each promoter. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: avatar_url
parameters.description: URL of the profile picture promoters can see on their dashboard

parameters.name: parent_promoter_id
parameters.description: Id of the parent if the promoter is a sub-affiliate

parameters.name: parent_promoter_email
parameters.description: Email of the parent promoter if the promoter is a sub-affiliate

parameters.name: created_at
parameters.description: ISO date string of the date of the signup event

parameters.name: skip_email_notification
parameters.description: Set this to `true` to skip email notifications. Default is `false`.

put.description: You can identify promoters by: `id`, `cust_id`, `auth_token` or `ref_id`(referral id). You need to pass at least one of these parameters.

parameters.name: cust_id
parameters.description: Your customer's user ID inside your application/system for the promoter. It will be available in the webhooks to identify the promoter in your system if you subscribe for FirstPromoter webhooks.

parameters.name: ref_id
parameters.description: Referral ID. If this is blank an ID is assigned based on the first name. Can be only `lower-case letters`, `numbers`, `-`(hyphen) and `_`(underscore)

parameters.name: new_ref_id
parameters.description: The new referral ID. Can be only `lower-case letters`, `numbers`, `-`(hyphen) and `_`(underscore)

parameters.name: auth_token
parameters.description: Authetication token generated when the promoter was created

parameters.name: promo_code
parameters.description: Unique promo code from your billing provider to assign to this affiliate for coupon tracking. This is also known as the `Coupon Code` or `Coupon ID`

parameters.name: customer_promo_code
parameters.description: Customer promo code from your billing provider to assign to this affiliate for coupon tracking. This is also known as `discount code` or `promotion code` or `display code`. This is the code your customer(s) can use on the checkout form/page.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to assign the promoter to. On the campaigns sections you can see the id as 'camp_id' query parameter on 'Promoter Sign Up page URL'. If there is no 'camp_id' it means the campaign is the default campaign and this parameter is not required.

parameters.name: temp_password
parameters.description: A temporary password promoters can use to log in to their dashboard if you don't use authentication tokens(auth_token) to sign promoters in automatically.

parameters.name: landing_url
parameters.description: You can set up a custom landing page url for this promoter. The referral id will be appended to it, unless the 'url_tracking' parameter(below) is used.

parameters.name: url_tracking
parameters.description: Set `true` to enable direct url tracking feature. FirstPromoter will do the tracking based on `landing_url`(above) without requiring the referral id to be appended to the url. The `landing_url` needs to be unique for each promoter. Default is `false`.

parameters.name: avatar_url
parameters.description: URL of the profile picture promoters can see on their dashboard

parameters.name: parent_promoter_email
parameters.description: Parent promoter email when promoter is a sub-affiliate

example.error: You need to find the promoter either by id, cust_id, auth_token, ref_id, promoter_email or promo_code

get.description:
You can identify promoters by: `id` , `cust_id` , `auth_token` , `promoter_email` or `ref_id`(referral id). You need to pass at least one of these parameters.**HTTP Request**
`GET https://firstpromoter.com/api/v1/promoters/show`

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
`required if promoter_email, ref_id, auth_token or cust_id is null` 

 `The promoter's ID inside FirstPromoter

parameters.name: promoter_email
parameters.description:
`required if id, ref_id, auth_token or cust_id is null` 
 
 The promoter's email

parameters.name: cust_id
parameters.description:
`required if id, ref_id, auth_token or promoter_email is null` 
 
 Your customer's user ID inside your application/system for the promoter.

parameters.name: ref_id
parameters.description:
`required if the promoter_email,auth_token, id or cust_id is null` 

 Referral ID.

parameters.name: auth_token
parameters.description:
`required if the promoter_email, id, ref_id or cust_id is null` 

 Authentication token generated when the promoter was created

example.error: You need to find the promoter either by id, cust_id, auth_token, ref_id, promoter_email or promo_code

delete.description:
You can identify promoters by: `id` , `cust_id` , `auth_token` , `promoter_email` or `ref_id`(referral id). You need to pass at least one of these parameters.**HTTP Request**
`DELETE https://firstpromoter.com/api/v1/promoters/delete`

parameters.name: cust_id
parameters.description: Your customer's user ID inside your application/system for the promoter.

parameters.name: ref_id
parameters.description: Referral ID. If this is blank an ID is assigned based on the first name. Can be only `lower-case letters`, `numbers`, `-`(hyphen) and `_`(underscore)

parameters.name: auth_token
parameters.description: Authentication token generated when the promoter was created

example.error: You need to find the promoter either by id, cust_id, auth_token, ref_id or promoter_email

get.description:
Use this endpoint to list your promoters using the API. The response will return the promoters as JSON array. Pagination details are held on response headers. Add `--include` option on `curl` request to see the pagination details format and links to next pages.**HTTP Request**
`GET https://firstpromoter.com/api/v1/promoters/list`

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: List all promoters accepted to a specific campaign.

post.description:
This endpoint will change the promoter's campaign to another one, keeping the referral ID the same (the affiliate wonâ€™t need to update the referral link). It serves the same function as moving the promoter to another campaign from the UI.More details on how it works can be found [here](https://help.firstpromoter.com/en/articles/2509650-moving-promoters-from-one-campaign-to-another).

You can identify promoters by: `id`, `cust_id`, `auth_token`, `promoter_email` or `ref_id`(referral id). **HTTP Request**
`POST https://firstpromoter.com/api/v1/promoters/move_to_campaign`

parameters.name: auth_token
parameters.description: Authentication token generated when the promoter was created

parameters.name: destination_campaign_id
parameters.description: ID of the campaign to switch/move to. It can be found on the url bar when editing the campaign

parameters.name: source_campaign_id
parameters.description: Only needed if the promoter is added to multiple campaigns. You can use this parameter to specify which campaign to change. If none is specified if will use as source the default campaign.

example.error: You need to find the promoter either by id, cust_id, auth_token, ref_id or promoter_email

post.description:
Use this endpoint to add a promoter to another campaign. Your promoter can have multiple campaigns to promote, each with its own referral link and referral ID.

You can identify promoters by `id`, `cust_id`, `auth_token`, `promoter_email` or `ref_id` (referral id). **HTTP Request**
`POST https://firstpromoter.com/api/v1/promoters/add_to_campaign`

parameters.name: auth_token
parameters.description: Authentication token generated when the promoter was created

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: ID of the campaign to add the promoter to. It can be found on the url bar when editing the campaign

example.error: You need to find the promoter either by id, cust_id, auth_token, ref_id or promoter_email

put.description:
Resetting the authentication token (`auth_token`), which is used to automatically sign in your promoters (if you use this feature), is not required but can enhance the security of the promoter dashboard. You can set up a cron job to call the API endpoint and store the new auth_token from the response.

You can identify promoters by id, cust_id, or auth_token; only one is required. **HTTP Request**
`PUT https://firstpromoter.com/api/v1/promoters/refresh_token`

parameters.name: auth_token
parameters.description: Authentication token generated when the promoter was created

example.error: You need to find the promoter either by id, cust_id, auth_token, ref_id or promoter_email

avatar_url.description: URL of the profile picture promoters can see on their dashboard

promo_code.description: Unique promo code from your billing provider to assign to this affiliate for coupon tracking. This is also known as the `Coupon Code` or `Coupon ID`

customer_promo_code.description: Customer promo code from your billing provider assigned to this affiliate for coupon tracking. This is also known as `discount code` or `promotion code` or `display code`. This is the code your customer(s) used on the checkout form/page.

campaign_id.description: ID of the campaign where the promotion runs.

cust_id.description: Your customer's user ID inside your application/system for the promoter. This will be included in the webhook event and can be used to identify the promoter in your system if you scribscibe for FirstPromoter's webhooks.

created_at.description: ISO date string when the promoter signed up

temp_password.description: A temporary password the promoter can use to log in to their dashboard if you don't use authentication tokens(`auth_token`) to sign promoters in automatically.

earnings_balance.description: Promoter's earnings balance. This object can contain `cash`, `credits`, `discount_per`

current_balance.description: Promoter's current balance. This object can contain `cash`, `credits`, `discount_per`

paid_balance.description: Promoter's paid balance. This object can contain `cash`, `credits`, `discount_per`

auth_token.description: Authentication token generated when the promoter was created
